DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate the progression of labour in 459 normal weight pregnant women (BMI <30) and 459 obese pregnant women (BMI <30) , not in labor admitted for induction of labor. These women are to be investigated for success of induction of labor.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Maternal Obesity on Labour Induction in Pastdate Pregnancy
DOC.detailed_description: - This prospective study will be conducted for 459 obese and 459 non obese ), post date (>41 wks), not in labor. - Woman is classified as obese if BMI >=30. - Prolonged pregnancy was defined as delivery on or after (41+0 weeks) of gestation. - First informed consent will be obtained. - Determination of gestational age - Proper history taking, general and abdominal examinations will be done then digital examination will be performed to determine bishop score. - And obstetric U/S scan will be done and by which the following data will be obtained : - Fetal biometry - Fetal heart activity - Presentation - Localization of the placenta. - Amount of amniotic fluid. - Exclude multifetal pregnancy. - Induction of labor will be done using vaginal misoprostol according to the estimated Bishop score.
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman. Post date >= 41 weeks. Absent onset of labor. Patient acceptance to join the study after signing an informed consent. â€¢ Malpresentation. Major degree of cephalopelvic disproportion. Placenta previa and or vasa previa. Previous CS. Multiple gestation. Indications of emergency CS. Any patient who will refuse to be a part of the study. IUFD.
